overview: Inside the strange and brutal regime of Kim Jong Un, the last Stalinist dictatorship, an underground opposition has somehow emerged. The leaders of North Korea are rattled by it. Who are the dissidents and how do they operate in the shadows? Jung-Eun Kim, a young Korean-American filmmaker, investigates a hidden revolution that's fueled by the unstoppable technology of cell phones and secret video.
title: North Korea: The Hidden Revolution
